t: For the choir director, for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
I*pn said, “I will guard my ways so*ln that I may not sin with my tongue; I*ln will guard my mouth with a muzzle as*ln long as the wicked are in my presence.”
I*ln was speechless and quiet; I*ln kept silent, even from speaking good, and*ln my pain intensified.
My*ln heart grew hot within me; as*ln I mused, a fire burned. I*ln spoke with my tongue:
“Lord,*sln make me aware of my end and*ln the number of my days so*ln that I will know how short-lived I am.
In*ln fact, you have made my days just inches long, and*ln my life span is as nothing to you. Yes,*ln every human being stands as only a vapor. Selah*ig
Yes,*ln a person goes about like a mere shadow. Indeed,*ln they rush around in vain, gathering*ln possessions without*ln knowing who will get them.
“Now,*pn Lord, what do I wait for? My*ln hope is in you.
Rescue*ln me from all my transgressions; do*ln not make me the taunt of fools.
I*ln am speechless; I do not open my mouth because*ln of what you have done.
Remove*ln your torment from me. Because*ln of the force of your hand I am finished.
You*ln discipline a person with punishment for iniquity, consuming*ln like a moth what is precious to him; yes,*ln every human being is only a vapor. Selah*ig
“Hear*pn my prayer, Lord,*s and*ln listen to my cry for help; do*ln not be silent at my tears. For*ln I am here with you as an alien, a*ln temporary resident like all my ancestors.
Turn*ln your angry gaze from me so*ln that I may be cheered up before*ln I die and am gone.”
